Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Underworld \Un"der*world`\, n. 1. The lower of inferior world; the world which is under the heavens; the earth. [1913 Webster]
That overspreads (with such a reverence) This underworld. --Daniel. [1913 Webster]
2. The mythological place of departed souls; Hades. [1913 Webster]
3. The portion of the world which is below the horizon; the opposite side of the world; the antipodes. [R.] [1913 Webster]
Fresh as the first beam glittering on a sail, That brings our friends up from the underworld. --Tennyson. [1913 Webster]
4. The inferior part of mankind. [R.] --Atterbury. [1913 Webster]
underworld n 1: the criminal class 2: (religion) the world of the dead; "he didn't want to go to hell when he died" [syn: {Hel}, {Hell}, {Hades}, {infernal region}, {netherworld}, {Scheol}]
